meanings.definition: In a short and stout manner
meanings.sent1: She walked dumpily to the bus stop, her feet shuffling along.
meanings.sent2: The old man moved dumpily through the crowded market.
meanings.sent3: The penguin waddled dumpily across the icy terrain, amusing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The bumblebee buzzed dumpily from flower to flower, collecting nectar lazily.
meanings.sent5: The toddler plopped dumpily onto the soft carpet, giggling happily.

meanings.definition: To move or sit in a squat and ungraceful way
meanings.sent1: The tired hiker dumpily sat on a rock to catch his breath.
meanings.sent2: The frog dumpily hopped from lily pad to lily pad in the pond.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to squeeze dumpily through the narrow gap in the fence, causing a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: The heavy raindrops dumpily fell from the dark clouds, soaking the ground below.
meanings.sent5: The robot dumpily navigated the obstacle course, bumping into walls along the way.
